title: Qld firefighter legislation rejected (AAP)
content:
Proposed legislation making it difficult for Queensland's volunteer firefighters to claim workers' compensation could be ditched. 

A committee reviewing the law - which would require volunteer firefighters to fight 150 fires over five years before they could become eligible for work-related cancer compensation - on Wednesday recommended it be scrapped by the government. 

Instead, it endorsed the LNP's policy of giving equal compensation support to firefighters regardless of their pay status.
